items.title: PNC Infratech bags Rs 2,039.61 crore contract from CIDCO for NAINA project, stock in focus
items.description: PNC Infratech shares are in focus as the company bagged a Rs 2,039.6 crore CIDCO project for infrastructure development in Navi Mumbai's NAINA region.

items.title: Ashoka Buildcon shares in focus on winning projects worth Rs 2309.99 crore
items.description: Ashoka Buildcon Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 284.75 and a 52-week low of Rs 120.90 on 06 September, 2024 and 26 October, 2023, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty Indicates a positive start; US markets gain, Asia trade mixed
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: The S&P 500 and the Dow scored record closing highs on Friday, with the big boosts from financial stocks after banks reported strong quarterly results while the latest inflation data fueled expectations for a U.S. Federal Reserve rate cut in November. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 409.74 points, or 0.97%, to 42,863.86, the S&P 500 gained 34.98 points, or 0.61%, to 5,815.03 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 60.89 points, or 0.33%, to 18,342.94.

items.title: First Tick: Top 10 global cues for todayâ€™s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is trading higher, indicating a positive start for the day.

items.title: Brokerage Radar | Mixed calls for Avenue Supermarts, outlook bullish for OMCs, life insurers
items.description: Check out the latest brokerage calls and analyst comments on the stocks in action today. Our coverage includes Avenue Supermarts, Just Dial, and Larsen & Toubro, among others. On the sectoral front, we have coverage on life insurers and oil marketing companies.

items.title: JPMorgan backs L&T stock with 'Overweight' rating, sees strong revenue growth, margin gains
items.description: JPMorgan initiates coverage on L&T with an 'Overweight' rating, citing strong growth prospects driven by India's capex cycle and robust margin improvements.

items.title: Analyst Call Tracker: Divi's Labs wins back favour after Nifty 50 departure
items.description: While supply chain diversification and the US Biosecure Act can help Divi's target the $800 million revenue opportunity from GLP-1 APIs, many brokerages also warned that these narratives are unlikely to materialise as quickly as investors expect.

items.title: Divergence in order bookings of TCS, Accenture warrants investor attention
items.description: Order inflows at TCS declined in last two quarters while Accenture reported strong growth in bookings

items.title: Live: Will Nifty continue to struggle for direction amid Earnings? RIL, HCL Tech Q2 | Opening Bell
items.description: Indian equity benchmarks are likely to open on positive note on OctoberÂ 14,Â tracking cues from GIFT Nifty thatâ€™s trading largely flat with a positive bias. On Friday, in yet another rangebound session, the Indian equity indices ended lower with Nifty closing below 25,000 and Sensex ending lower by 0.3%. Â Global cues are mixed with Wall Street notching fresh highs on Friday and this morning Asia is mixed as Chinaâ€™s stimulus underwhelmed once again. Among cues to watch, RIL, HCL Tech will report earnings today and this week Hyundai Motor Indiaâ€™s IPO will open for subscription. Among other stocks, watch out for HAL, Avenue Supermarts, L&T. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Ruchit Jain, Lead Research Analyst at 5Paisa and Sandip Agarwal -Fund manager, Sowilo Investment Managers.

items.title: Agri Picks Report October 14, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, India's vegetable oil imports declined 30% on year to 1.09 million tonnes in September, the Solvent Extractors' Association of India said Friday.

items.title: Chart of the Day | The untapped potential of India's mutual funds
items.description: While financial savings account for 46% of gross household savings, only 6% is allocated to mutual funds, underscoring the significant growth potential in the mutual fund industry

items.title: CONCOR shares slip 2% after Morgan Stanley issues 'Underweight' rating
items.description: Container Corporation of India (CONCOR) stock slipped in early trade after Morgan Stanley assigned an Underweight rating with a target price of Rs 774, highlighting concerns over the company's growth trajectory.

items.title: Stocks On Radar: Ashoka Buildcon, IL&FS, Wipro Ltd, PNC Infratech in Focus| 14 October
items.description: In todayâ€™s stock market update, we cover the latest key investments and deals. Ashoka Buildcon secures Rs 2,310 crore worth of projects in Maharashtra, while IL&FS Transportation sells its expressway unit to Roadstar Investment for â‚ą545 crore. Wipro announces a bonus issue and its Q3 results, PNC Infratech wins a Rs 2,091 crore project near Navi Mumbai International Airport, and Adani Ports completes the acquisition of a 95% stake in Gopalpur Port. Stay tuned for more market insights!

items.title: Analyst Call Tracker: Why PowerGrid stock picked up maximum downgrades in last quarter?
items.description: Power Grid has faced a wave of downgrades from major brokerages in Jul-Sep quarter, due to valuation concerns, a shift towards renewable energy, and slowing demand, leading to a decline in 'buy' recommendations.

items.title: GQG partners, promoter entities buy Adani Group shares worth Rs 19,000 crore in September quarter
items.description: Adani Group promoters raised their stakes in four of their listed entities:Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, Adani Enterprises Ltd, Adani Green Energy Ltd, and Adani Power Ltd, while reducing their stake in Ambuja Cements. The total value of these holdings is approximately Rs 12,778 crore.

items.title: Hathway Cable stock jumps 3% after Q2 profit, revenue rise
items.description: Hathway Cable & Datacom shares surged, buoyed by a robust Q2 FY25 report showcasing a net profit increase to Rs 25.8 crore, despite mixed results across its segments.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty closes above 25,100, Sensex gains 592 points, led by IT, realty, bank stocks
items.description: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, HDFC Life, L&T, HDFC Bank were among the top gainers on the Nifty, while losers were ONGC, Maruti Suzuki, Tata Steel, Bajaj Finance and Adani Enterprises.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Stocks and sectors that moved the most on October 14
items.description: The Sensex and Nifty closed in the green on October 14, lifted by strong performances from bank and IT stocks. Here are some stocks that moved the most in trade today.

items.title: Live: Nifty reclaims 25,100 driven by IT & Realty| RIL, DMart in focus| Closing Bell
items.description: Markets soared today with Nifty reclaiming 25,100 and Sensex jumping over 600 points, nearing 82,000. IT and realty stocks led the gains, while banks surged. However, metals lagged as Chinese stimulus fell short of expectations. Top Nifty gainers included Wipro, Tech Mahindra, and HDFC Bank, while ONGC, Maruti, and Tata Steel were among the losers. Join Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they break down the key stocks on their radar, including Aptus Value, BSE, and Raymond.

items.title: Buy CIE Automotive India; target of Rs 650: Motilal Oswal
items.description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on CIE Automotive India recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 650 in its research report dated October 11, 2024.
